Elihu<S>453</S> spake<S>6030</S> moreover, and said<S>559</S>,
Thinkest<S>2803</S> thou this to be right<S>4941</S>, that thou saidst<S>559</S>, My righteousness<S>6664</S> is more than God's<S>410</S>?
For thou saidst<S>559</S>, What advantage<S>5532</S> will it be unto thee? and, What profit<S>3276</S> shall I have, if I be cleansed from my sin<S>2403</S>? <sup>if: or, by it more than by my sin</sup>
I will answer<S>7725</S> <S>4405</S> thee, and thy companions<S>7453</S> with thee. <sup>answer: Heb. return to thee words</sup>
Look<S>5027</S> unto the heavens<S>8064</S>, and see<S>7200</S>; and behold<S>7789</S> the clouds<S>7834</S> which are higher<S>1361</S> than thou.
If thou sinnest<S>2398</S>, what doest<S>6466</S> thou against him? or if thy transgressions<S>6588</S> be multiplied<S>7231</S>, what doest<S>6213</S> thou unto him?
If thou be righteous<S>6663</S>, what givest<S>5414</S> thou him? or what receiveth<S>3947</S> he of thine hand<S>3027</S>?
Thy wickedness<S>7562</S> may hurt a man<S>376</S> as thou art; and thy righteousness<S>6666</S> may profit the son<S>1121</S> of man<S>120</S>.
By reason of the multitude<S>7230</S> of oppressions<S>6217</S> they make the oppressed to cry<S>2199</S>: they cry out<S>7768</S> by reason of the arm<S>2220</S> of the mighty<S>7227</S>.
But none saith<S>559</S>, Where is God<S>433</S> my maker<S>6213</S>, who giveth<S>5414</S> songs<S>2158</S> in the night<S>3915</S>;
Who teacheth<S>502</S> us more than the beasts<S>929</S> of the earth<S>776</S>, and maketh us wiser<S>2449</S> than the fowls<S>5775</S> of heaven<S>8064</S>?
There they cry<S>6817</S>, but none giveth answer<S>6030</S>, because<S>6440</S> of the pride<S>1347</S> of evil men<S>7451</S>.
Surely God<S>410</S> will not hear<S>8085</S> vanity<S>7723</S>, neither will the Almighty<S>7706</S> regard<S>7789</S> it.
Although<S>637</S> thou sayest<S>559</S> thou shalt not see<S>7789</S> him, yet judgment<S>1779</S> is before<S>6440</S> him; therefore trust<S>2342</S> thou in him.
But now, because it is not so, he hath visited<S>6485</S> in his anger<S>639</S>; yet he knoweth<S>3045</S> it not in great<S>3966</S> extremity<S>6580</S>: <sup>he hath: that is, God hath</sup> <sup>he knoweth: that is, Job knoweth</sup>
Therefore doth Job<S>347</S> open<S>6475</S> his mouth<S>6310</S> in vain<S>1892</S>; he multiplieth<S>3527</S> words<S>4405</S> without<S>1097</S> knowledge<S>1847</S>.
